text: Laurence Monroe Klauber (December 21, 1883 â€“ May 8, 1968), was an American herpetologist, businessman and inventor. He was known for his works on rattlesnakes. He was the first curator of reptiles and amphibians at the San Diego Natural History Museum and Consulting Curator of Reptiles for the San Diego Zoo. ==References== Category:1883 births Category:1968 deaths Category:American inventors Category:Scientists from San Diego Category:Businesspeople from San Diego Category:Stanford University alumni
title: Laurence Monroe Klauber
